devicediscovery.eli5: It’s like your smart home looking around the room asking, ‘Who’s here?’
devicediscovery.boss: Device discovery automatically identifies and lists compatible devices on your network to streamline integration.
devicediscovery.sysadmin: Discovery protocols (like mDNS, SSDP, UPnP, or Zeroconf) scan the local network to detect available devices and their capabilities.
devicediscovery.use_case: Used to automatically add a new smart plug to Home Assistant when it's powered on.

selfhosting.eli5: It’s like having your own mini internet right in your house.
selfhosting.boss: Self-hosting means running your own software or services instead of relying on external cloud platforms.
selfhosting.sysadmin: Involves hosting applications (e.g., Home Assistant, MQTT brokers) locally on devices like Raspberry Pi, Docker, or NAS for privacy and control.
selfhosting.use_case: Used to run a Home Assistant server without relying on the cloud.

lanpolling.eli5: LAN polling is like checking every few seconds to see if your smart stuff is awake.
lanpolling.boss: LAN polling checks devices on the local network at regular intervals to verify status or availability.
lanpolling.sysadmin: Uses IP scanning, ARP pings, or protocol-specific handshakes to detect and refresh the presence of devices on a local subnet.
lanpolling.use_case: Used to detect if a smart TV is still online in Home Assistant via ping sensor.
